meanings.definition: In a manner showing strong support for a particular party, cause, or person.
meanings.sent1: She cheered partisanly for her favorite team during the game.
meanings.sent2: He always votes partisanly for his political party.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed partisanly for more treats.
meanings.sent4: The sun shone partisanly on the blooming flowers.
meanings.sent5: The students worked partisanly on their group project.

meanings.definition: Showing bias or prejudice towards a particular group or cause.
meanings.sent1: The article had a partisanly slanted view on the issue.
meanings.sent2: Her partisanly remarks offended some of the audience.
meanings.sent3: The dog gave a partisanly bark at the mailman.
meanings.sent4: The clouds formed a partisanly shape in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's grading seemed partisanly unfair to some students.
